benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered: PUT Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios (with required header only, with optional headers, with/without existing custom fields) verify 204 and DB persistence.
PUT Non-Existing Resource: 404 for unknown invoiceItemId and empty DB states covered.
Input Validation: 400 for invalid UUID format, malformed JSON, empty body, unsupported fields.
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy presence validated (400 when missing); optional Reason/Comment covered.
Large Payloads: Max/near-max payload and 413 handling considered.
Resilience: 500 (DB down), 503 (dependent service down), and 504 (timeout) covered.
Idempotency: Repeated identical PUT requests remain consistent and return 204.
State Variations: No prior fields vs existing fields; empty vs partially populated DB.
Edge/Negative: Unexpected query param; SQL injection payloads rejected (400/422).
Performance: Parallel updates across many items and single large-payload timing validated.
gaps: PUT Partial Update semantics: No tests define whether PUT replaces all custom fields vs merges; behavior for omitted fields, duplicates, or clearing via empty array is not covered.
Concurrency on same resource: No scenarios for simultaneous updates to the same invoice item (race conditions, last-write-wins, optimistic locking).
Content-Type/Accept headers: No tests for missing or incorrect Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) or Accept negotiation.
Header value validation: No tests for CreatedBy/Reason/Comment being empty strings, overly long, or containing special/Unicode characters; max length and charset constraints untested.
Error contract: Tests don’t assert structured error schema (code, type, message, details) or correlation IDs; only generic messages checked.
CustomField schema depth: No validation for invalid data types per field, nulls, max lengths, reserved/duplicate keys, or Unicode handling.
Atomicity for arrays: No scenario with mixed valid/invalid CustomField entries to verify all-or-nothing behavior and per-item error reporting.
Authorization 403: No coverage for authenticated but unauthorized user (insufficient permissions/tenant mismatch).
Rate limiting: No scenario for 429 Too Many Requests or retry headers.
Response headers: No verification of headers on 204 (e.g., Content-Type presence/absence), or consistency with "produces: application/json".
Data integrity scope: No explicit check that only the targeted invoice item is affected and other items remain unchanged beyond regression note.
Idempotency nuance: No test for reordering array elements, duplicate field entries, or replay after server error.
recommendations: Define and test PUT semantics: add scenarios for full replacement vs merge, including sending a subset and an empty array to confirm clear/delete behavior.
Add same-resource concurrency tests: parallel PUTs by different users to the same invoice item; assert expected conflict handling or last-write rules; include optimistic locking if supported.
Validate HTTP headers: tests for missing/wrong Content-Type and Accept; assert proper 415/406 or 400 as applicable.
Strengthen header value validation: empty, whitespace-only, long, special/Unicode values for CreatedBy/Reason/Comment; assert limits and sanitization.
Assert standardized error schema and response headers: verify error body fields (code, message, details) and presence of correlation/request-id; validate Content-Type behavior for 204.
Expand CustomField schema tests: wrong types, nulls, over-length keys/values, reserved names, duplicates, Unicode/emoji, and SQLi/XSS coverage with specific rejection paths.
Test array atomicity: submit mixed valid/invalid entries and confirm transactional behavior (all fail) or documented partial acceptance with per-item errors.
Add authorization 403 scenarios: authenticated user lacking permission or cross-tenant access to ensure correct denial.
Introduce rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429 and verify Retry-After headers.
Data integrity tests: verify no side effects on other invoice items and unrelated invoice data after updates; assert audit records created with CreatedBy/Reason/Comment.
Idempotency edge cases: resend same request after transient 5xx; reorder array items; include duplicate entries; ensure consistent final state.
Clarify and test for response contract on success: confirm body is empty for 204 and whether any headers (e.g., Location, ETag) are expected or explicitly absent.
